newsitem.title: USA: Fischer Imaging sees Q4 loss, lower revs.
newsitem.headline: Fischer Imaging sees Q4 loss, lower revs.

text.p: Fischer Imaging Corp said on Wednesday it expects a fourth quarter loss and revenues to fall to $15 million from $23 million in last year's fourth quarter.
It is expected that the resulting fourth quarter loss will reduce previously reported nine month earnings of $2.3 million, to approximately break-even for the year, the company said.
For the year, revenues are expected to be $78 million, as compared to $77 million in 1995, the company said.

Fischer Imaging said lower revenues for the 1996 fourth quarter were primarily attributable to 50 percent lower original equipment manufacturer revenues, including a decline in Tilt-C shipments to GE Medical Systems.
The company said its 1996 bookings for proprietary products are up over 20 percent from 1995 and the backlog for these products is up 80 percent over that at the end of 1995, Fischer Imaging said.
Fischer Imaging said factory utilization will improve in 1997, while the company cuts operating expenses.
